1.verse: Yahweh’s word that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel.

4.verse: What the swarming locust has left, the great locust has eaten.

5.verse: Wake up, you drunkards, and weep!

6.verse: For a nation has come up on my land, strong, and without number.

7.verse: He has laid my vine waste,

8.verse: Mourn like a virgin dressed in sackcloth for the husband of her youth!

9.verse: The meal offering and the drink offering are cut off from Yahweh’s house.

12.verse: The vine has dried up, and the fig tree withered;

13.verse: Put on sackcloth and mourn, you priests!

16.verse: Isn’t the food cut off before our eyes,

17.verse: The seeds rot under their clods.

20.verse: Yes, the animals of the field pant to you,

2.verse: A day of darkness and gloominess,

4.verse: Their appearance is as the appearance of horses,

5.verse: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains, they leap,

6.verse: At their presence the peoples are in anguish.

11.verse: Yahweh thunders his voice before his army;

12.verse: “Yet even now,” says Yahweh, “turn to me with all your heart,

13.verse: Tear your heart, and not your garments,

14.verse: Who knows? He may turn and relent,

17.verse: Let the priests, the ministers of Yahweh, weep between the porch and the altar,

18.verse: Then Yahweh was jealous for his land,

20.verse: But I will remove the northern army far away from you,

22.verse: Don’t be afraid, you animals of the field;

23.verse: “Be glad then, you children of Zion,

24.verse: The threshing floors will be full of wheat,

25.verse: I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten,

26.verse: You will have plenty to eat, and be satisfied,

27.verse: You will know that I am among Israel,

28.verse: “It will happen afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh;

29.verse: And also on the servants and on the handmaids in those days,

30.verse: I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth:

31.verse: The sun will be turned into darkness,

32.verse: It will happen that whoever will call on Yahweh’s name shall be saved;

3.verse: and have cast lots for my people,

4.verse: “Yes, and what are you to me, Tyre, and Sidon,

5.verse: Because you have taken my silver and my gold,

6.verse: and have sold the children of Judah and the children of Jerusalem to the sons of the Greeks,

7.verse: Behold, I will stir them up out of the place where you have sold them,

8.verse: and I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hands of the children of Judah,

11.verse: Hurry and come, all you surrounding nations,

14.verse: Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision!

15.verse: The sun and the moon are darkened,

17.verse: “So you will know that I am Yahweh, your God,

18.verse: It will happen in that day,

20.verse: But Judah will be inhabited forever,
